# Tools

## Essential Tools for Value Chain Hackers

In the Value Chain Hackers program, we leverage a variety of open-source and self-hosted tools to facilitate collaboration, project management, communication, and more. Here's an overview of the tools you'll be using:

### Communication üì¢

- **Nextcloud**: An open-source platform for file sharing and collaboration. Use it for sharing documents, managing calendars, and more.
  [Nextcloud](https://nextcloud.com/)

- **Discord**: An online communication tool that integrates seamlessly with our digital workspace, perfect for instant messaging and voice/video calls.
  [Discord](https://discord.com/)

### Project Management üõ†Ô∏è

- **Taiga**: An open-source agile project management platform. Manage tasks, sprints, and backlogs with ease.
  [Taiga](https://www.taiga.io/)

### Collaboration ü§ù

- **Etherpad**: An open-source collaborative text editor for real-time document editing. Great for working together on documents.
  [Etherpad](https://etherpad.org/)

- **Nextcloud**: Also used for file sharing and collaboration.
  [Nextcloud](https://nextcloud.com/)

### Version Control üîÑ

- **GitLab**: An open-source Git repository management platform for version control and collaboration.
  [GitLab](https://about.gitlab.com/)

- **SmartGit**: A graphical Git client with support for GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab.
  [SmartGit](https://www.syntevo.com/smartgit/)

- **GitHub**: Another popular open-source Git repository hosting service.
  [GitHub](https://github.com/)

### Document Creation üìÑ

- **LibreOffice**: An open-source office suite for creating documents, spreadsheets, and presentations.
  [LibreOffice](https://www.libreoffice.org/)

- **Quarto**: A tool for creating dynamic documents from Markdown.
  [Quarto](https://quarto.org/)

- **Zotero**: An open-source reference management software for organizing research sources and citations.
  [Zotero](https://www.zotero.org/)

### Virtual Meetings üìπ

- **Jitsi**: An open-source video conferencing platform for hosting virtual meetings and webinars.
  [Jitsi](https://jitsi.org/)

- **BigBlueButton**: An open-source web conferencing system designed for online learning and collaboration.
  [BigBlueButton](https://bigbluebutton.org/)

### Survey and Feedback üìù

- **LimeSurvey**: An open-source online survey software for creating and conducting surveys and assessments.
  [LimeSurvey](https://www.limesurvey.org/)

- **Moodle**: An open-source learning management system for creating online courses and assessments.
  [Moodle](https://moodle.org/)

### Learning Management Systems (LMS) üìö

- **Moodle**: Highly customizable and widely used, supporting course management, assessment tools, and collaborative activities.
  [Moodle](https://moodle.org/)

- **Canvas LMS**: Known for its user-friendly interface and support for multimedia content.
  [Canvas LMS](https://www.canvaslms.com/)

- **Chamilo**: Designed for schools, universities, and corporate training, offering course creation, assessments, communication tools, and reporting.
  [Chamilo](https://chamilo.org/)

- **ILIAS**: Focused on usability and accessibility, suitable for various educational settings.
  [ILIAS](https://www.ilias.de/)

- **Open edX**: Developed by edX, providing tools for creating and delivering online courses, including interactive content and discussion forums.
  [Open edX](https://open.edx.org/)

- **Claroline**: Focuses on simplicity and ease of use, suitable for small to medium-sized organizations.
  [Claroline](https://claroline.net/)

- **ATutor**: Designed with accessibility in mind, providing features for creating accessible content and adaptive learning.
  [ATutor](https://atutor.github.io/)

## Conclusion

These tools are essential for the successful execution of your projects within the Value Chain Hackers program.
